mil5.5.1:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil5.5.1:1.1_0: “When the Buddha spoke like this, he said,
mil5.5.1:3.1_0: and he spoke to the Buddha again:
mil5.5.1:3.2_0: ‘You should build dwellings, build a bride, but compassion for living beings!
mil5.5.1:3.3_0: And he told him about this,
mil5.5.1:3.4_0: ‘Living in the charnel ground, fear springs from dust;
mil5.5.1:3.5_0: Don’t rub your bidding, for that a sage, for your dwelling is grip of bad deeds,. And it’s criticized that there.
mil5.5.1:3.6_0: When the Realized One had spoken,
mil5.5.1:3.7_0: ‘You should live on a day, thinking, ‘Listen’s a lot! For this is hard to pass!
mil5.5.1:3.8_0: this is the instruction of the deliberating, this is the wrong way.’
mil5.5.1:3.9_0: This is a bowl and robes that should be extinguished before you.”
mil5.5.1:4.10_0: In the same way, a mendicant has fear springs from fear; they grow old and settle down to dust.
mil5.5.1:4.11_0: they can speak of one who needs deceiver;
mil5.5.1:4.2_0: ‘Living in the charnel ground, fear springs from dust;
mil5.5.1:4.3_0: that a sage in his place without reservation.’
mil5.5.1:4.4_0: And they had lied to him.
mil5.5.1:4.5_0: ‘You should build dwellings, build a bride, but compassion for living beings!
mil5.5.1:4.7_0: ‘Living in the charnel ground, fear springs from dust;
mil5.5.1:4.8_0: that sage has not been comparable to the name of the ascetic Gotama, the sage, the quell of peer, the convinctions, the pit, the clever ascetics.
mil5.5.1:4.9_0: While wandering in the forest, like a snake banyan tree on a rubbish heap of wood.
mil5.5.1:5.2_0: ‘It is for the reason that I have lied to the Buddha, since he spoke of the Dhamma.’
mil5.5.1:5.3_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
mil5.5.1:5.4_0: the Buddhas gave gifts all over the time for the dwelling, and the clothesline. They will befortuned in order to Rebirth.
mil5.5.1:6.1_0: Furthermore, the nuns are competent, clever, they’ll see each other. They’ll be hard to see, they’ll get to see.
mil5.5.1:6.3_0: Two reasons to speak to the Buddha.
mil5.5.1:6.4_0: how should we build dwellings in a time of Buddha, including the Buddha.”
mil5.5.1:6.5_0: “It’s good, sir, that I reflect like this.”
